summary: This is an FBI Special Agent's affidavit submitted to a U.S. Magistrate Judge in support of a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence at 9 East 71st Street. It details probable cause based on a 2019 indictment alleging Epstein sexually abused and sex trafficked minor girls at the premises from approximately 2002 to 2005, and includes corroborating information from a victim (Victim-1) and property records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary target of the investigation, accused of sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking conspiracy. The affidavit states he owned, possessed, and controlled the Subject Premises where the alleged abuse occurred.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: The judge before whom the affidavit was sworn on July 6, 2019, and who is asked to issue the search warrant.

persons.name: Victim-1
persons.context: A victim identified in the indictment who was sexually abused by Epstein at the Subject Premises between approximately 2002 and 2005 while under 18. She provided detailed descriptions of the interior layout to investigators and is pursuing a civil claim against Epstein.

connections.description: Epstein is alleged to have sexually abused Victim-1 on multiple occasions at his New York residence when she was a minor.
The affidavit states Epstein or his associates paid victims, including Victim-1, in cash following sexual encounters.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse at New York Residence
events.description: The indictment alleges Epstein sexually abused multiple minor girls at his residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, during this period.

events.title: Property Transfer to Maple, Inc.
events.description: Ownership of 9 East 71st Street was transferred from Nine East 71st Street Corp. to Maple, Inc., a Virgin Islands entity, for $10, a transaction the affidavit suggests was a sham to maintain Epstein's control.

events.title: Swearing of Search Warrant Affidavit
events.description: The FBI Special Agent swore to the affidavit before Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses, seeking a warrant to search and document Epstein's New York residence.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York (Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, the 'Subject Premises')
U.S. Virgin Islands (where Epstein was known to reside and where Maple, Inc. is registered)
keyFacts: The affidavit establishes probable cause that Epstein's residence at 9 East 71st St. contained evidence of sex trafficking of minors and a related conspiracy from at least 2002-2005.
Victim-1 provided detailed, corroborated descriptions of the interior layout of the residence where she was abused as a minor, which the FBI sought to document via the search.

Property records show the residence was owned by a corporation with Epstein as President, then transferred to a Virgin Islands entity (Maple, Inc.) for $10 in 2011, suggesting continued control by Epstein.
Epstein listed the 9 East 71st Street address as a residence on his Sex Offender Registration at the time of the affidavit.
The affidavit notes Victim-1's past issues (marriage fraud, substance abuse, work at a massage parlor) but asserts her information has proven reliable and corroborated by other evidence.
